Chemistry.exceptions package¶

Submodules¶

Chemistry.exceptions.ParseErrors module¶

exception Chemistry.exceptions.ParseErrors.ParsingException(msg='An error occured while parsing {} file', filetype='CML')¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

A generic exception to be thrown if there is an error with the parsing of a chemical data file

message = 'An error occured while parsing {} file'¶
exception Chemistry.exceptions.ParseErrors.UnsupportedFileTypeException(msg, filetype)¶

Bases: Chemistry.exceptions.ParseErrors.ParsingException

Chemistry.exceptions.ReactionErrors module¶

exception Chemistry.exceptions.ReactionErrors.NoReactionError(msg='No reaction occured')¶

Bases: Chemistry.exceptions.ReactionErrors.ReactionError

A specific reaction error that should be thrown if the given scenario would not give rise to that specific type of reaction. I imagine that this should sort of be handled like StopIteration would be

err_message = 'No reaction occured'¶
exception Chemistry.exceptions.ReactionErrors.ReactionError(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

A generic error to be thrown when there is an error with a reaction that does not have any specific error to be thrown

err_message = 'There was an error with the reaction'¶
pka = '\n AcidBase reaction between {} and {} failed because of pka difference {}\n ({} to {})\n '¶
